title: Tufts University
summary: Tufts University is a private research university on the border of Medford and Somerville, Massachusetts. It was founded in 1852 as Tufts College by Christian universalists who sought to open a nonsectarian institution of higher learning.[7] It was a small New England liberal arts college until its transformation into a larger research university in the 1970s, though its corporate name is still "The Trustees of Tufts College".[8] Tufts is classified among "R1: Doctoral Universities â€“ Very high research activity", and it became a member of the Association of American Universities, a selective group of major research universities in North America, in 2021.[9][10] Tufts emphasizes active citizenship and public service in all its disciplines, and is known for its internationalism and study abroad programs.[11][12]
